@@ -23,7 +23,7 @@ You should call the `update` function in the `goTown` function.
 assert.match(goTown.toString(), /update\(\s*\)/);
 ```
 
-Don't forget your ending semi-colon.
+Don't forget your ending semicolon.
 
 ```js
 assert.match(goTown.toString(), /update\(\s*\)\s*;/);

@@ -23,7 +23,7 @@ You should use `let` to declare `newWeapon`.
 assert.match(code, /let\s+newWeapon/);
 ```
 
-`newWeapon` should be initialised to have the value of `weapons`. Don't forget your semi-colon.
+`newWeapon` should be initialised to have the value of `weapons`. Don't forget your semicolon.
 
 ```js
 assert.match(buyWeapon.toString(), /newWeapon\s*=\s*weapons\s*;/);

@@ -15,7 +15,7 @@ Here is how you can make a `GET` request with the `fetch()` method:
 fetch("url-goes-here")
 ```
 
-Make a `GET` request to this URL: `https://cdn.freecodecamp.org/curriculum/news-author-page/authors.json`. Don't terminate your code with a semi-colon yet.
+Make a `GET` request to this URL: `https://cdn.freecodecamp.org/curriculum/news-author-page/authors.json`. Don't terminate your code with a semicolon yet.
 
 # --hints--
 
@@ -25,7 +25,7 @@ You should use the `fetch()` method to make a `GET` request to `https://cdn.free
 assert.match(code, /fetch\(\s*('|"|`)https:\/\/cdn\.freecodecamp\.org\/curriculum\/news\-author\-page\/authors\.json\1\s*\)/)
 ```
 
-You should not have a semi-colon after your `fetch` call.
+You should not have a semicolon after your `fetch` call.
 
 ```js
 assert.notMatch(code, /fetch\(\s*('|"|`)https:\/\/cdn\.freecodecamp\.org\/curriculum\/news\-author\-page\/authors\.json\1\s*\)\s*;/)

@@ -20,7 +20,7 @@ fetch("sample-url-goes-here")
 
 Chain the `.then()` method to your `fetch` call. Inside the `.then()` method, add a callback function with `res` as a parameter, then log the `res` to the console so you can see the `Response` object. Open your console and expand the `Response` object to see what it contains.
 
-Again, don't terminate the code with a semi-colon yet.
+Again, don't terminate the code with a semicolon yet.
 
 # --hints--
 
@@ -54,7 +54,7 @@ You should log the `res` parameter to the console so you can see the `Response`
 assert.match(code, /fetch\(\s*('|"|`)https:\/\/cdn\.freecodecamp\.org\/curriculum\/news\-author\-page\/authors\.json\1\s*\)\s*\.then\(\s*(\(\s*res\s*\)|res)\s*=>\s*console\.log\(\s*res\s*\)\s*\)/)
 ```
 
-You should not have a semi-colon after your `.then()`.
+You should not have a semicolon after your `.then()`.
 
 ```js
 assert.notMatch(code, /fetch\(\s*('|"|`)https:\/\/cdn\.freecodecamp\.org\/curriculum\/news\-author\-page\/authors\.json\1\s*\)\s*\.then\(\s*(\(\s*res\s*\)|res)\s*=>\s*console\.log\(\s*res\s*\)\s*\)\s*;/)

@@ -25,7 +25,7 @@ You should implicitly return `res.json()` in your `.then()`.
 assert.match(code, /\.then\(\s*(\(\s*res\s*\)|res)\s*=>\s*res\.json\(\s*\)\s*\)/)
 ```
 
-You should not have a semi-colon after your `.then()`.
+You should not have a semicolon after your `.then()`.
 
 ```js
 assert.notMatch(code, /\.then\(\s*(\(\s*res\s*\)|res)\s*=>\s*res\.json\(\s*\)\s*\)\s*;/)

@@ -20,7 +20,7 @@ You should use the `fetch()` method to make a `GET` request to `https://cdn.free
 assert.match(code, /fetch\(\s*('|"|`)https:\/\/cdn\.freecodecamp\.org\/curriculum\/news\-author\-page\/authors\.json\1\s*\)/)
 ```
 
-Your first `.then()` should not have a semi-colon.
+Your first `.then()` should not have a semicolon.
 
 ```js
 assert.notMatch(code, /\.then\(\s*(\(\s*res\s*\)|res)\s*=>\s*res\.json\(\s*\)\s*\)\s*;/)

@@ -41,7 +41,7 @@ You should use `let` to declare a `character` variable.
 assert.match(__helpers.removeJSComments(code), /let\s+character/);
 ```
 
-Your declaration should end with a semi-colon.
+Your declaration should end with a semicolon.
 
 ```js
 assert.match(__helpers.removeJSComments(code), /let\s+character;/);

@@ -37,7 +37,7 @@ You should concatenate your `row` variable to your `\n` escape sequence.
 assert.match(__helpers.removeJSComments(code), /result\s*\+\s*('|")\\n\1\s*\+\s*row/);
 ```
 
-You should assign the entire concatenation back to your `result` variable. Don't forget your semi-colon.
+You should assign the entire concatenation back to your `result` variable. Don't forget your semicolon.
 
 ```js
 assert.match(__helpers.removeJSComments(code), /result\s*=\s*result\s*\+\s*('|")\\n\1\s*\+\s*row;/);

@@ -34,7 +34,7 @@ You should use `let` to declare your `secondCharacter` variable.
 assert.match(__helpers.removeJSComments(code), /let\s+secondCharacter/);
 ```
 
-You should not assign a value to your `secondCharacter` variable. Do not forget your semi-colon.
+You should not assign a value to your `secondCharacter` variable. Do not forget your semicolon.
 
 ```js
 assert.match(__helpers.removeJSComments(code), /let\s+secondCharacter;/);

@@ -29,7 +29,7 @@ You should not assign the value `"Test"` to your `secondCharacter` variable.
 assert.notEqual(secondCharacter, "Test");
 ```
 
-You should assign the value of the `character` variable to your `secondCharacter` variable. Don't forget your semi-colon.
+You should assign the value of the `character` variable to your `secondCharacter` variable. Don't forget your semicolon.
 
 ```js
 assert.match(__helpers.removeJSComments(code), /secondCharacter\s*=\s*character;/);

@@ -17,7 +17,7 @@ You should add a `console.log` call.
 assert.lengthOf(__helpers.removeJSComments(code).match(/console\.log/g), 2)
 ```
 
-You should log your `call` variable. Don't forget the semi-colon.
+You should log your `call` variable. Don't forget the semicolon.
 
 ```js
 assert.match(__helpers.removeJSComments(code), /console\.log\(\s*call\s*\);/);

@@ -21,7 +21,7 @@ Your function should declare a `test` variable.
 assert.match(padRow.toString(), /var\s+test/);
 ```
 
-You should initialise `test` with the value `"Testing"`. Don't forget the semi-colon.
+You should initialise `test` with the value `"Testing"`. Don't forget the semicolon.
 
 ```js
 assert.match(padRow.toString(), /var\s+test\s*=\s*('|")Testing\1;/)
